text: Marion Catholic High School (sometimes referred to as Marion Catholic Junior/Senior Preparatory High School) was a private, Catholic high school in Marion, Ohio, United States that was established in 1879 by three sisters from the Sisters of Charity. It was part of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Columbus. In March 2013, it was announced by Bishop Frederick F. Campbell that Marion Catholic would close following the 2012–13 school year due to declining enrollment and financial concerns. The first class graduated in 1882 and the current building was opened in 1957.http://www.marioncatholic.org/ABOUT_US.html The building was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2017. The Marion Catholic Fighting Irish participated in the Northwest Central Conference. == Ohio High School Athletic Association State Championships == * Boys Track and Field – 1989 == Notable alumni == * Ed McCants, basketball player == References == == External links == * Category:High schools in Marion County, Ohio Category:Educational institutions established in 1879 Category:1879 establishments in Ohio Category:Educational institutions disestablished in 2013 Category:2013 disestablishments in Ohio Category:Defunct Catholic secondary schools in Ohio Category:Buildings and structures in Marion, Ohio Category:School buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in Ohio Category:National Register of Historic Places in Marion County, Ohio
title: Marion Catholic High School
